entry.title: Amanda Lee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the U.S. Navy's Blue Angels' first female fighter jet demonstration pilot, Amanda Lee (pictured), uses the call sign "Stalin"?

entry.title: Charles, Prince of Wales (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1984, Charles, Prince of Wales described a proposed extension to the National Gallery as a "monstrous carbuncle"?

entry.title: The Messenger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the editorial staff of online news startup The Messenger includes former editors-in-chief of Gizmodo, Entertainment Weekly, People, and Self?

entry.title: İbrahim Çolak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that İbrahim Çolak's 2019 gold medal in still rings was Turkey's first at the World Artistic Gymnastics Championships?

entry.title: Battle of Shiloh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the time, the Battle of Shiloh was the largest battle fought in the United States, with nearly 24,000 casualties?

entry.title: Plas Dinas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lord Snowdon and Princess Margaret spent much time at his family's Welsh country mansion Plas Dinas, but after his father's death the estate went to Snowdon's younger half-brother?

entry.title: Michael Block (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Michael Block, a club professional who charges $150 per hour for golfing lessons, scored a hole in one on his way to finishing joint 15th at the 2023 PGA Championship?

entry.title: Patrician IV (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one critic called Patrician IV a "very dry affair"?
